intro: Relbunium hirtum, commonly known as the hairy relbunium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbel-like clusters. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving the plant its common name. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Relbunium hirtum is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates.
